overview: From 2025-07-27 to 2025-08-03, ethereum-optimism/optimism had 10 new PRs (0 merged), 6 new issues, and 18 active contributors.

topIssues.title: min-base-fee: add `minBaseFee` configuration variable to `SystemConfig` contract
topIssues.author: geoknee
topIssues.body:
A new method should be added

```solidity
function setMinBaseFeeLog2(uint8 minBaseFeeLog2) external onlyOwner;
```

which emits a `ConfigUpdate` event with a new `UpdateType`: `UpdateType.MINIMUM_BASE_FEE`.

See ratified design doc https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/design-docs/pull/295

topIssues.title: alert when non-flashblocks-enabled sequencer is active or flashblocks are turned off
topIssues.author: yashvardhan-kukreja
topIssues.body:
We plan to enable flashblocks with a backup sequencer with no flashblocks components. And in case, leadership transfer converges to the backup sequencer, that can be representative of an issue with flashblocks.

Have an alert for that i.e. when the leadership is stuck at a non-flashblocks-enabled sequencer.

Moreover, this alert should cover the scenario when the active sequencer is turned off with flashblocks or is not producing them. It's critical for EOC to know if flashblocks production is impacted intentionally (due to rollup-boost killswitch) or unintentionally

topIssues.title: alert on low peer count health of flashblocks-enabled sequencer
topIssues.author: yashvardhan-kukreja
topIssues.body:
Considering the criticality on the presence of healthy peers of a flashblocks-enabled sequencers, we should have an alert capturing the situation when the peer count drops below a number like 3 or 4.

This alert should span across non-leader sequencers as well.

topIssues.title: op-service: Event Call Graph
topIssues.author: pcw109550
topIssues.body:
Add a logic to "trace" the event flow.
For example, when `ReceivedBlockEvent` event is emitted, we get a below call trace in the happy path scenario.
```
p2p.ReceivedBlockEvent [09ab623c]
└── clsync.ReceivedUnsafePayloadEvent [9277ffe6]
    └── engine.ForkchoiceRequestEvent [aca04240]
        └── engine.ForkchoiceUpdateEvent [e024a814]
            └── engine.ProcessUnsafePayloadEvent [78c3546d]
                ├── engine.UnsafeUpdateEvent [c5a17e39]
                │   ├── engine.PromoteCrossUnsafeEvent [a67127ca]
                │   │   └── engine.CrossUnsafeUpdateEvent [0e2159d5]
                │   └── engine.TryUpdateEngineEvent [a40cff76]
                └── engine.ForkchoiceUpdateEvent [ba5224e4]
```

topPRs.title: feat: introduce configurable min basefee
topPRs.author: wlawt
topPRs.body:
<!--
Contributions welcome! See https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/.github/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md
-->

From: https://github.com/wlawt/optimism/pull/10

**Description**

<!--
A clear and concise description of the features you're adding in this pull request.
-->

This PR lets the rollup [configure the minimum base fee](https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/design-docs/blob/main/protocol/minimum-base-fee.md) via `SystemConfig`.


**Tests**

<!--
Please describe any tests you've added. If you've added no tests, or left important behavior untested, please explain why not.
-->

- Expanded test coverage for existing unit tests that referenced Holocene/EIP1559Params
- Added acceptance tests: `op-acceptance-tests/tests/jovian/min_base_fee_test.go`
- Added fork tests:
   - `op-e2e/actions/proofs/jovian_activation_test.go`
   - `op-e2e/actions/upgrades/jovian_fork_test.go`
- Added e2e tests:
    - `op-e2e/system/fees/minbasefee_test.go`

**Additional context**

<!--
Add any other context about the problem you're solving.
-->

topPRs.title: fix superchainConfig upgrade issue & support multiple superchainConfigs
topPRs.author: AmadiMichael
topPRs.body:
This PR includes the following:

- Fix for the superchainConfig upgrade bug via comparison using a new SemverComp library.
- Separate the superchainConfig upgrade logic into it's own function.
- Make the OPCM (asides the `deploy` function) to support custom superchainConfigs.
- Modify the `opcm-upgrade-check` script to check the new `upgradeSuperchainConfig` function too.
- Tests added/modified for the above 4 changes.

topPRs.title: op-node, op-devstack: initial execution multiplexing
topPRs.author: nonsense
topPRs.body:
**Description**

This PR is adding support for op-node to run multiple execution engines for a given chain.

Design document at: https://www.notion.so/oplabs/Execution-Multiplexing-Specific-Implementation-and-Plan-23af153ee1628051a7e4ece97fff689e

Fixes: https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/optimism/issues/16822

topPRs.title: Go implementation updates for CWIA creator pattern
topPRs.author: ajsutton
topPRs.body:
**Description**

Update a lot of the op-deployer go code to handle the updated fault dispute game deployment. Not sure what's left because there are still warnings in the contracts which causes the build to fail before it gets to actually running the go tests. The ones I've run locally are now passing though.

**Tests**

Some unit tests are still commented out - need to work out what they were actually testing and move them to the right place.

**Additional context**

Builds on https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/optimism/pull/16340

topContributors.summary: wlawt: Focused on introducing a configurable minimum base fee to the Optimism protocol, opening two related feature pull requests in `ethereum-optimism/op-geth` (#648) and `ethereum-optimism/optimism` (#16852). They also contributed to project discussions through 5 review comments and comments on 2 issues.

sebastianst: Focused on core client maintenance by merging a significant upstream dependency update in `ethereum-optimism/op-geth#652`. This large PR (+8448/-2386 lines) incorporated the `go-ethereum v1.16.1` release, keeping the client synchronized with its upstream dependencies. They also contributed to collaboration by leaving 2 review comments.

AmadiMichael: Focused on addressing a bug related to superchain configuration this week. They opened a pull request (ethereum-optimism/optimism#16838) to fix a superchainConfig upgrade issue. This work consisted of changes to configuration and test files.

ajsutton: This week, ajsutton advanced the Go implementation for the CWIA creator pattern in the ethereum-optimism/optimism repository via an open pull request (#16869). Their work involved modifying 35 files (+158/-276 lines), with changes split evenly between tests and other code.

HiteshMittal07: Expanded the Superchain ecosystem by adding the Arena Z Testnet configuration via PR ethereum-optimism/superchain-registry#1092. This contribution involved modifying configuration and documentation files. Their work primarily focused on tests and configuration to support the new testnet.

krofax: This week, krofax focused on improving developer documentation by opening a pull request to update the L2 rollup testnet tutorial (ethereum-optimism/docs#1705). This work proposes a significant content refactor, involving +765/-1097 lines of changes across documentation and configuration files.

serpixel: This week, serpixel focused on enhancing acceptance testing within the `ethereum-optimism/optimism` repository by opening a pull request (#16920) to port Fjord (Holocene) tests to the development environment.

geoknee: Focused on planning and specifying a new `min-base-fee` feature for the Ethereum Optimism protocol. They created four issues to define the required work across multiple repositories, including writing the specification in `specs#742` and outlining implementation details in `op-geth#649` and `optimism#16839`.

yashvardhan-kukreja: Focused on improving system reliability and observability within the `ethereum-optimism/optimism` repository. They created three issues to enhance monitoring, proposing new alerts for sequencer health (#16868, #16867) and tracking the deployment of a mempool rebroadcaster cronjob (#16932).
cuiweixie: This week, their work was focused on the `ethereum-optimism/optimism` repository, where they opened a pull request (#16937). This PR proposes updating the math/rand package in `op-node`.

Wazabie: This week, Wazabie focused on a bugfix, opening a pull request to fix the respected game template in ethereum-optimism/superchain-ops (#1157). This work involved significant changes across 139 files (+2203/-1838 lines) over 5 commits. All of their contributions were concentrated on modifying the project's tests.
zhiqiangxu: Contributed a minor bugfix this week, opening a pull request to correct a comment related to opcm-upgrade-checks in the ethereum-optimism/optimism repository (#16913).
pcw109550: Focused on the `ethereum-optimism/optimism` repository, where they created issue #16874 to propose an "Event Call Graph" for the `op-service`.

mslipper: Focused on release coordination this week, creating an issue to manage the rollout and release of the op-batcher (ethereum-optimism/optimism#16843). This work indicates a focus on deployment processes within the ethereum-optimism/optimism repository.
